title: Sidereus Space Complete Short-Duration Hot Fire Test Campaign
summary:
Italian launch startup Sidereus Space Dynamics has announced the completion of a short-duration hot fire test campaign for its MR-5 rocket engine. Sidereus Space was founded in 2019 with the aim of developing a small reusable single-stage-to-orbit (SSTO) launch vehicle called EOS. The vehicle will stand at 3.5 metres tall and will be capable of […]
The post Sidereus Space Complete Short-Duration Hot Fire Test Campaign appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Another U.S. Lunar Lander Lifts Off
summary: A U.S. spacecraft is once again on its way to the Moon. If successful, it will be the first U.S. lunar lander since the Apollo era.  Pittsburgh-based Astrobotic tried last […]

title: Falcon 9 launches first Intuitive Machines lunar lander
summary: An Intuitive Machines spacecraft is on its way to the moon Feb. 15 in the company’s quest to be the first commercial entity to successfully land on the lunar surface.

title: Transitioning From ISS to Commercial Space Stations: Plenty of Questions, But Few Answers
summary: A congressional hearing today illuminated a wide range of policy issues awaiting resolution as the International Space Station nears its end, but the answers remain elusive. The ISS is expected […]

title: NASA selects ultraviolet astronomy mission but delays its launch two years
summary: NASA has selected an ultraviolet observatory for development but will delay its launch by two years because of budget challenges.

title: Varda gets reentry license for space manufacturing capsule
summary: After months of effort and one rejected application, Varda Space Industries said Feb. 14 it has received an FAA license for its first reentry capsule.

title: SpaceX launches U.S. missile-defense satellites
summary: The USSF-124 mission carried six small satellites: two for the Missile Defense Agency and four for the Space Development Agency.

title: Startup pitches AI tool to prevent Pentagon procurement blunders
summary: Company says AI can flag risks in procurements by analyzing historical data

title: After 8 months stuck in orbit, Varda’s drug spacecraft gets FAA approval to return
summary: Space startup Varda received long-awaited approval from the Federal Aviation Administration to bring its first spacecraft back to earth after a stint manufacturing drugs in space.

title: Chinese launch startup Orienspace secures $83.5 million
summary: Chinese launch firm Orienspace announced a series B funding round shortly after its successful debut launch, as China moves to nurture its growing commercial space ecosystem.
